json.text: So, we're the Efrons, I'm Zac, this is my brother, Dylan.
We heard that you were looking for gear testers.
We're here to apply.
Listen, I'm gonna give you two boys a chance.
If you succeed, we might have something for you and if you fail, well, at least you won't
freeze to death.
We promise we won't let you down.
Let's go.
Let's go to the van.
We're gonna make sure it's tough for you.
Seriously, thank you so much.
So we got our assignment from Gert and we're doing it our way, road tripping!
Montana, here we come.
When was the last time you went outside and went camping?
You look so much like Zac Efron.
I am Zac.
Oh my god!
And when are you going to?
I mean, I grew up in a small town surrounded by wilderness, so for me, the clearest way
to reconnect with myself, to find myself is through the wilderness and we both get kinda
cooped up in our lives and I have to remind myself to get outside.
Anyone can get out of here, anyone can do this.
You can get in your car and just go, find some place new.
I mean, Montana feels so far away but it's really close, it's drivable.
The van has been a personal dream of mine since I can remember, since grandma
and grandpa had the Westfalia.
But it's really one of the first times I ever experienced the outdoors, we were in Yosemite
and we like lived out of that van.
Dylan was just young and running around. My mom and dad were both there and I couldn't believe that you
could drive a house.
Our first morning here was insane, we pulled up to Lake McDonald which I've never been
to before.
First thing I did was jump in the water and it was mind blowing.
There's just so much out here, there's vast mountains, there's mossy trees that we're
running through and rivers and glaciers.
And there's wildlife everywhere.
It's just beautiful, out here it's just life.
Feel it in the trees, you can feel it.
We can summit the continental divide that was what we set out to do here and started
it 5.30 AM and we were hiking until 10 PM.
Literally, we climbed up the mountain, we crossed the big drift, we were the last ones
up there, we did outlast everyone.
It's dark and we were warm in our Columbia gear.
Honestly, that's the cool thing about traveling is like every journey, who knows, you might
find something incredibly special out there.
